moves.1. d4:
please note that: !! = very good move, ! = good move, ?? = very bad move (blunder), ? = bad move (mistake), !? = maybe 

good maybe bad move.

d4 flowed by c4 to open the game.
moves.2... dxc4 3. e4: to control the center and to open the way for the light bishop.
moves.4. g3: to find another way for the bishop and preparing for castling.
moves.5. Bg2: protection and preparing for early castling.
moves.6... h6: to prevent white knight from jumping to j5.
moves.7. a3: to prevent dark bishop to go to b4 to check the king.
moves.8. Nc3: developing, defense for pawn in e4 and attacking b5 pawn if the defense problem is solved. !
moves.12. Nef4: attacking e6 pawn and the queen after that.
moves.12... Kf7: blunder, protection by the king, no hope for castling any more plus exposed to the coming attacks. ??
moves.13. Qh5+: black king is in a real danger. !!
moves.13... Kg8 14. Nxe6: to be closer to the king and attacking the queen. !!
moves.14... Qc8 15. Qg4: attacking pawn in g7 and threatening of checkmate. !
moves.17. Qf5 Kf7: blunder, did not see the coming attack of the knight in h3. ??
moves.18. Nhxg5+: black pawn in f6 is pinned by the queen. !
moves.18... Ke8 19. Qg6+ Kd7 20. Nc5+ Bxc5: blunder, it will cost him his queen. ??
moves.21. Bh3+: now the black queen is dead. !!
moves.22... Bxc8: i think if he capture black bishop with the rock is much much better. ??
moves.23. Qg7+: yes, now he is going to lose his rock and dark bishop one by one.
moves.23... Bd7 24. Ne6+: bishop is pinned by the queen. !!
moves.24... Kb7:
now i can capture :
- the rock by the queen  or
- the dark bishop by the pawn in d4  or
- the dark bishop by the knight with check.
moves.25. Nxc5+: of course i had chosen the third one. !
moves.25... Kc7: now the turn is for the rock.
moves.26... fxe5 27. fxe5: to give the way to the rock to share in the battle. !
moves.27... Bh3: wastage of time, because i am going to move it to check the king in f7. ?
moves.28... Kb6 29. Qd8+:
at this position my opponent resigned.
conclusion : 
1- my opponent is a good chess player, he made a mistake, but we all make mistakes. 
2- annotation is a very hard job, i hope that my friend the reader will appreciate what i have done and may be the beginners will learn some thing.

 friend of all mustafa
